name: Shell
tagline: PHP extension Shell written in Zephir code.
body:
Shell Zephir extension
---
Shell is a php extension aimed to ease creation command-line php-scripts.

### Installation:

1. Install Zephir (http://zephir-lang.com/install.html)
2. run `zephir build`
3. Enable shell.so
```
# echo "extension=shell.so" > /etc/php5/conf.d/shell.ini
```

### Common Usage:
```php
<?php
use \Shell\Shell;

$shell = new Shell;
$shell->init();
$shell->registerHandler(/* handler callback here */);
$shell->registerOptions(array(
	// ... script options here
));
$shell->process();
```

**Handler** can be any valid callback, for example:
```php
$shell->registerHandler(function (Shell $shell, array $arguments) {
	...
});
```

### Test script
More complex example of usage is **script.php**.
Run it one of this ways:
```
./script.php
./script.php --help
./script.php --version
./script.php --mode=colors
./script.php --mode=curl
./script.php --mode=streams
```

At the moment list of implemented features:
---

1. Parsing command-line arguments according types (`Shell::registerOptions()`).
2. Networking via `Curl` class.
3. Output colorizing (`Shell::colorize()` and `Shell::background()`)
4. Using Input/Output streams via `Streams` class.
